article:
The 'social environment', 'social context', 'sociocultural context', or
'milieu', refers to the immediate physical and social setting in which people
live or in which something happens or develops. It includes the culture that the
individual was educated or lives in, and the people and institutions with whom
they interact. [http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1446600/pdf/112-
49033.pdf Elizabeth Barnett, PhD and Michele Casper, PhD, A Definition of
âSocial Environmentâ, American Journal of Public Health, March 2001, Vol. 91,
No. 3]

The interaction may be in person or through communication media, even anonymous
or one-way, Marjorie Taylor, Imaginary Companions (1999) p. 147 and
may not imply equality of social status. Therefore the social environment is a
broader concept than that of social class or social circle.
